Description: Funerary papyrus of Soter Pakerer containing First Book of Breathing (abridged version) written in hieratic script on the recto and verso. A single line of demotic is written on the verso.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Found with P. BM EA 10282 on the mummy inside coffin BM EA 6705 in the collective tomb of the archon Soter.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 81-82, pls. 42-43.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (229)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.81-82, pls.42-43)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57803) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57803)
Vleeming 2015 / Demotic graffiti and other short texts gathered from many publications (no.1996, p.347)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured Black ink Backed: white paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window mount Binding: leather (deteriorated) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
